document.masterDocTitle: Diagnoses and discussion of the group 1 and 2 Brazilian species of Heteragrion , with descriptions of four new species (Odonata: Megapodagrionidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Diagnoses and discussion of the group 1 and 2 Brazilian species of Heteragrion , with descriptions of four new species (Odonata: Megapodagrionidae)

subSubSection.paragraph: Figs. 11 ( ♂ app), 30A–C ( ♂ thx), 42A–C ( ♀ thx), 47A–B ( ♀ S8–10, basal plate), 50A–B ( ♂ , ♀ habitus), 60 ( ♂

Heteragrion aurantiacum Selys, 1862: 25
[23 reprint] (description of male and female); Selys 1886: 60 (species diagnosis,
H. amazonicum
and
H. cinnamomeum
as synonym); Calvert 1909: 114–115 , Fig. 40 (discussion, illustration of male appendages in mediodorsal view); Williamson 1919: 26–28 , Figs. 21–22, 78–79, 111, 121–122, 141–142, 143–144 (species diagnosis and illustration of head of male and female, male appendages in mediodorsal and lateral views, male and female prothorax in dorsal view); Santos 1968: 13–15 , Figs. 1–4 (larval description, illustration of larval habitus, antennae, labium, female S9–10); Santos 1970: 149 (distribution record); De Marmels 1987: 231 (similarity of
H. silvarum
in coloration to
H. aurantiacum
); Costa & T. C. Santos 1999: 2 (comparison with
H. consors
larva); Costa & T. C. Santos 2000: 4 (key); Lencioni 2005: 126 , Figs. 75A–C (description and distribution, illustration of male appendages in mediodorsal, dorsal and lateral views); Machado 2006: 1065 (comparison with
H. beschkii
); von Ellenrieder & Garrison 2007: 6 (mention and illustration of male appendages); Garrison et al 2010: 88 (list).

Types .
syntype males (examined) in IRSNB and female syntype in MCZ (not examined). The male examined with the following labels: "
H. aurantiacum
[manuscript black ink on pale blue paper]" and "Cl. 3[manuscript black ink on dark blue paper]".

Distribution .
Brazil (states of Bahia , Espírito Santo , São Paulo , Rio de Janeiro ), Paraguay , Argentina , Venezuela . From 0 to 1074 m a.s.l. It is sympatric with
H. consors
in Caraguatatuba and Ubatuba, with
H. tiradentense
in Salesópolis, and with
H. brianmayi
in Ubatuba.

Diagnosis .
Male
: thorax with yellow line bordering black middorsal carina and no additional dark stripe on pterothorax (yellow line also bordered by dark line in older specimens) (Figs. 30A, 30B). Cercus in lateral view: small dorsobasal and ventrobasal expansions present. Almost straight (Fig. 11B). Cercus in mediodorsal view: basal, medial and apical portions subequal. No ventral expansion present. Medial process wide triangular plate, apex slightly bifurcate and not forming two distinct arms, with sclerotized ridge crossing middle of process (Fig. 11A). Female : thorax with yellow line bordering black middorsal carina and no additional dark stripe on pterothorax (yellow line also bordered by dark line in older specimens) (Figs. 42A, 42B). Female very close to female
H. consors
(and sympatric in several localities). Main structural difference between females shape of prothorax, roughly triangular in
H. aurantiacum
(Fig. 42C) and rectangular in
H. consors
(Fig. 42D). Valves of ovipositor not reaching distal S10, and in lateral view, ventral margin with small spines. Cercus longer than S10, with tuft of bristles at tip ( Fig. 47A ). Basal plate: dorsal edge very long, ventral edge very small giving triangular appearance, outer edge almost straight and forming very acute angle with ventral edge of ovipositor ( Fig. 47B ). Main difference in coloration two dark semicircles lateral to each compound eye in
H. consors
female (Fig. 42E),

not observed in females of
H. aurantiacum
(Fig. 42A); darker mark on antefrons of
H. aurantiacum
triangular (rectangular in
H. consors
), and labrum without dark marks in
H. aurantiacum
(Fig. 42A), large dark mark in center in
H. consors
(Fig. 42E).
